info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 03 at 5:14PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Meagher, Judith Basin, Fergus, southwestern Blaine, southeastern Hill, southeastern Chouteau and southeastern Cascade Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 512 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles south of Big Sandy to 16 miles east of White Sulphur Springs. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. Thunderstorms were also developing out ahead of this line. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Stanford, Geraldine, Denton, Hobson, Winifred, Moore, Geyser, Fergus, Windham, Sapphire Village, Utica, Danvers, Hilger, Iliad, Buffalo, Moccasin, Ackley Lake State Park, Glengarry, and Garneill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, especially if camping, consider seeking shelter inside a building or vehicle. Heavy rainfall of up to one inch per hour is also occurring with some of these storms. This may lead to minor localized flooding, or debris flow in steep terrain. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
